meanings.definition: To accumulate a backlog of work or tasks.
meanings.sent1: I am backlogging my assignments for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up backlogging her emails when she's busy.
meanings.sent3: The student joked that he was backlogging so much homework, he might need a second backpack.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing inbox was backlogging her ability to respond promptly.
meanings.sent5: Backlogging paperwork can lead to a chaotic work environment.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a backlog of items or tasks.
meanings.sent1: Backlogging can happen when tasks pile up.
meanings.sent2: The backlogging of orders caused delays in shipping.
meanings.sent3: The team turned the office move into a backlogging competition.
meanings.sent4: The backlogging of requests made it hard to keep up with demand.
meanings.sent5: The backlogging of paperwork was a sign of inefficiency.

meanings.definition: The state of having a backlog of work or tasks.
meanings.sent1: The backlogging in the department was causing delays.
meanings.sent2: She felt overwhelmed by the backlogging of assignments.
meanings.sent3: The backlogging of chores made the weekend seem never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The backlogging of projects was hindering progress.
meanings.sent5: The backlogging of emails made it hard to find important messages.
